introContent.text:
A quadratic equation is a polynomial equation of degree 2, which can be written in the standard form:

\(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\)

where:

  • \(a \neq 0\) (if \(a = 0\), the equation becomes linear)
  • \(a\), \(b\), and \(c\) are real numbers
  • \(x\) is the variable

items.title: Factoring Method
items.content: Break down the quadratic expression into factors: \((x + p)(x + q)\)
